entry.title: AI for SAC mobile
entry.content:
I've successfully connected my SAC instance to my mobile system, but in the app I can currently only display files.  

I want to display the Just-Ask search function in my mobile app as well.

How can I go about enabling this?

entry.title: Styling Rules Bug New Table Build Experience
entry.content:
We have changed the table type. Since the styling rules were not preserved, we recreated them. The issue is that although the styling rules work correctly in edit mode, they stop working in view mode.

This didn't happen before, so we believe this may be a bug related to the new table type.

entry.title: SAC - Heatmap CSS
entry.content:
Hi guys,

is there a way to apply a different color in an Heatmap using CSS or something else to highlight the row of totals more clearly?

 

Thanks,

G

entry.title: SAP Analytics cloud : How Valur Driver Tree Inverse formula works
entry.content:
Hi All,
I am trying to use the Inverse formula logic. But i am observing a limitation in this. 
Creaed a VDT like below...

In the model i am writing the below mentioned formula for Volume .

[002]*[003]|(INVERSE([002]:=[001]/[003]) or (INVERSE([003]:=[001]/[002])))
When ever i am entering the values in Volume , the automatic value is adjusting for Price only. 
I read the documenation about the Inverse formula, where it works for first mentioned logic only. 

Is there any way to implement this inverse formula to populate the values proportionally back to price and quantity.
Thanks..

entry.title: How to show relevant variance in Bar Chart based on Filter selection using story Filter?
entry.content:
Hello,

How to show relevant variance in Bar Chart based on Filter selection using story Filter?  

I have Bar chart to compare the measures (Sales Input, Sales output) for different versions (Actual, Budget, Forecast). To compare data created two variances (Actual vs Budget, Actual vs Forecast)

I select all versions, the variance showing for both (Actual vs Budget, Actual vs Forecast). But if select version filter as Actual Budget still it is showing both variances where I don’t want to see Actual Vs Forecast.

How to achieve this requirement. How to show Variance on bar chart based on my Filter selection.

If I select Actual, Budget, the variance should show (Actual vs Budget) and If I select Actual, Forecast, the variance should show (Actual vs Forecast) only.

See below both variance Actual vs Budget and Actual vs Forecast showing even I select Filter Actual, Budget

Regards,

Vasu

entry.title: How to count unbooked dimension members in SAP Datasphere for coverage calculation?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working in SAP Datasphere and I need to calculate the coverage percentage of active customers each month.
Specifically, I want to:

  1. Count all customers in my base (from the customer dimension).

  2. Count all customers who had sales in a given month (from the fact table).

  3. Divide the two results to calculate the monthly coverage percentage.

The challenge is that unbooked dimension members (customers with no sales in the selected month) are not being counted, since Datasphere’s support for unbooked members seems to be limited.

Is there a recommended approach or workaround to include unbooked members (dimension members without fact data) in the calculation?
For example, any way to simulate “Show unbooked members” or force the join to consider all dimension members when building measures or analytical models?

Thanks in advance for any guidance or best practices!

entry.title: Is there a way to prevent a user from creating stories but allow insight and folder creation?
entry.content:
All,

Is there a combination of permissions that can be used in a role that allows the user to create/update/delete folders and data analyzer insights but prevents the creation of Stories/Dashboards in SAC? I know a Data analyzer permission exists and also a Private and Public Folder permission that allows creation/manage but I can't find anything that would be Story specific. The use case is for end users to have the ability to create and organise their insights into folders but without having the ability to create/edit Stories.

Thanks

Kris

entry.title: Unlock the Power of Analytics with the New SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook
entry.content:
Are you ready to take your sales and service operations to the next level? The brand-new SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook – Analytics is here to help you unlock the full potential of embedded analytics in your SAP environment. 

 

Why Analytics Matter More Than Ever 

In today’s fast-paced business world, having real-time insights is not just a luxury—it’s a necessity. The playbook shows how Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) empowers both end users and key users to build, consume, and act on analytical content directly within SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2. With role-based dashboards, KPIs, and real-time reporting, you can make smarter decisions, faster. 

 

What’s Inside the Playbook? 

  • Clear Value Propositions: Learn how analytics save time, improve efficiency, and keep your teams on target. No more manual data crunching—get critical information at your fingertips. 
  • Step-by-Step Adoption Guidance: Identify opportunities for analytics adoption across sales managers, reps, service managers, and administrators. The playbook helps you assess your current visibility and highlights where analytics can drive the most impact. 
  • Lead-to-Cash Journey Mapping: See how analytics support every stage of the customer journey—from lead qualification and opportunity conversion to order delivery and post-sale follow-up. 
  • Business KPIs That Matter: Discover the key metrics that drive sales and service success, including pipeline management, lead conversion rates, SLA compliance, and agent performance. 
  • Best Practices and Real Results: Explore real-world examples and best practices that have delivered measurable business outcomes, such as faster opportunity identification, improved data quality, and optimized service team performance. 
  • Getting Started Made Easy: The playbook provides practical setup instructions for provisioning SAC, configuring single sign-on, managing user replication, and designing analytical stories tailored to your business roles. 

 

See Analytics in Action 

The playbook is packed with visuals and examples, including: 

  • Home screen KPI dashboards for sales reps 
  • Lead funnel and pipeline insights 
  • Forecast trackers and pipeline flow diagrams 
  • Service case overviews and escalation metrics 
  • Agent performance dashboards and SLA compliance tracking 

Resources at Your Fingertips 

Ready to dive deeper? The playbook links to solution guides, webcasts, blogs, and video tutorials to help you get started and maximize your analytics investment. 

Don’t miss out on the opportunity to transform your sales and service operations. Download the new SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook – Analytics today and empower your teams with the insights they need to succeed! 

Find the download link of the SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Customer Playbook here: SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 - Analytics Playbook

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Storie Visualization
entry.content:
Hello everyone!
I'm creating a story from a model connected to SuccessFactors. The issue I'm trying to resolve is this: when I select the "Department" dimension, it only displays the code and not the name.
In SF, the "Department" field has both the code and the name. Therefore, I don't understand why Customer Service only displays the code.
Could you help me?

entry.title: SAC Numeric Point - How to show last year same day value
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'm working on a SAC story where I need to display the current day's sales and the sales from the same day in the previous year using numeric points.

However, I've run into a challenge. When I tried using the Previous Year function with a Restricted Measure, I encountered an error stating: "date dimension must be filtered on a single value on Month or a higher level," which prevented the previous year's data from displaying.

To work around this, I created a Calculated Measure using the formula:

LOOKUP([Sales], [d/Date] = Previous("Day", 365))

This works in most cases, but it has a flaw: it misaligns dates in leap years (e.g., February 29th vs. March 1st).

I've attached some screenshots. The first one is my story filter, the other two are the errors of the restricted measure I came across.

Does anyone know a more reliable method to display the previous year's same-day sales in a numeric point?

I'd appreciate any insights or better approaches!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: SAC NavigationUtils.openApplication or NavigationUtils.openStory with pageBar=disable
entry.content:
Hi,

is it possible to put the pageBar=disable into the UrlParameter.create? It doesnt work for me.

NavigationUtils.openApplication("xxx",[UrlParameter.create('mode','embed'),UrlParameter.create('pageBar','disable')], true);

 

Afterwards at OnInit I have this to prevent it, but i wanted to disable pagebar before go into OnInit Script:

if (Application.getMode() !== ApplicationMode.Embed) {
NavigationUtils.openApplication(
Application.getInfo().id,
[
UrlParameter.create("mode", "embed"),
UrlParameter.create("pageBar", "disable")
],
false
);
}

entry.title: Is it possible to update styling rules via scripting in SAC?
entry.content:
Hello,

Here is the requirement. I want to define a custom styling rule within a table for two columns with different color. The table displays data at day granularity. The requirement is to highlight last two days of the previous month. For ex, if my planning cycle starts from Oct 2025, then 29 Sept and 30 Sept should be highlighted. If my planning cycle starts from Nov 2025, then 30 Oct and 31 Oct should be highlighted. I tried to follow the standard styling rule approach but the dynamic nature of requirement is causing an issue. I don't know if it is possible in SAC either via Scripting or by standard functionality.

Anyone who has faced this similar issue, or know the workaround in this scenario. Their comments would be deeply appreciated.

Thanks

Basically, we trying to extract S/4HANA data from custom CDS view based on ACDOCA table,

and also register that CDS view with OData using by annotation (@Odata.push : true)

 

Question : We will extract actual data for every month, but how can i deal with limitation for 'OData'.

(*Not exactly, but there is 800K row limitation when extract data for one time)

So, I just think when extract for imported connection, we have to do filtering by date just one month every time like below image.

 

If you have any great ideas, please share with me.

Thank you!

entry.title: Calculation % of Sales for each division and month without formula bar
entry.content:
Dear All,

I am currently facing challenges with creating a custom calculation in SAP Analytics Cloud. My objective is to calculate the percentage of Sales for each division for each month.

So far, I have successfully sum the monthly Sales values using the Aggregation function. In the next step, I need to compute a simple ratio:

(Sales / Total Sales) * 100

However, the output I receive is always 1, which indicates an issue with the calculation logic.

I am able to achieve the correct result using the formula bar, but this approach does not meet my requirements because I need to schedule the report in Excel format, and custom calculations created in the formula bar are not included in scheduled exports.

I would greatly appreciate any suggestions or best practices to resolve this issue.

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Measure based on last variable selected
entry.content:
I've created a variable filter so the user can choose the period.

The value of ANNOMESE are 202501 , 202502, 202503... So the user specifies "Annomese" start and "Annomese" end:

Most of the measured consider the interval selected, but I need to create a measure that is filtered only by the last value of the variable selected by the user.

I've also created the dimension AnnoMeseDay to have a date dimension.
Can I create in my analytical model? Do I need to create on SAC?

entry.title: SAC Story Filter - Daily/YTD & Comparison Basis
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'm looking to set up two filters in my SAC story:

1. A range filter that allows selection of Daily/MTD/QTD/YTD.

2. A Comparison Basis filter with options: Last Month/Last Quarter/Last Year/Budget.

I want the data in the story to update dynamically when these filters are adjusted. For example:

- If I select "Daily" and "Last Year," the story should display two values: the Actual Value for today, and the calculation (Actual Value Today - Last Year’s Same Day Value) / Last Year’s Same Day Value.

- If I switch to "MTD" and "Budget," it should automatically update to show MTD Actual Value and (MTD Actual Value - MTD Budget Value) / MTD Budget Value.

I’ve attached a screenshot for reference.

Does anyone have tips or best practices for implementing this kind of filter functionality in SAC?

Thanks in advance!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: SAC Currency Sign for Singapore Dollar
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'm working with SAP Analytics Cloud and need help formatting Singapore Dollar (SGD) values to display as currency symbols like "SG$" or "S$" in my stories.

Here's my current setup and issue:

- I’m using imported data, and in the model, I’ve set the currency to a fixed value of "SGD".

- In SAC Administration, I’ve changed "Show Currency As" to "Symbol" (instead of "ISO Code") to display currency symbols.

This works for other currencies: AUD shows as "AU$", HKD as "HK$", and USD as "$". However, SGD still displays as the ISO code "SGD" instead of a symbol like "SG$" or "S$".

Has anyone encountered this? Is there a setting or workaround to get SGD to display with its currency symbol in SAC? Any tips would be appreciated!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Measure calculated through variable
entry.content:
I've created a filter variable so the users can choose "start YearMonth" and "end YearMonth".

My goal is to create a measure that is filtered only by the "end YearMonth". How can I do?
If It can be useful I've also a dimension "YearMonthDay" which is in date format.

entry.title: Preparation Cerification SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I’m currently preparing for the C_SAC_2501 exam, and I have some doubts about a few questions. Please, I would really appreciate your help to better understand the correct answer to each question.


You have a dimension with members for product groups and products. Each product group has associated products. You want to plan by product group without disaggregating into the products.

How can you do this?

Disable allocations
Use two properties
Disable distribution
Use two hierarchies


You are creating a new public version. Which categories can you use?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Forecast
Budget
Predictive
Actual
You are creating a script for an advanced data action. Which character designates a virtual variable member?

%
/
#
.


You have a story in My Files. You want your colleague to review and comment on the story. What must you do?

Create a Review task for the story
Add a Comment widget to the story
Include the story in a Discussion
Share with View access


What can you do to reduce the data refresh time when opening a story? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Avoid tables with more than 500 rows and 60 columns
Load widgets in the background
Avoid prompts
Use responsive pages
Use conditional formatting


You have a live data model with two dimensions: Firstname and Lastname. Users want a single dimension in the data model that displays the dimensions as Lastname, Firstname.

What must you do?

Create the combined data in the source system data model.
Create a calculated dimension in the story.
Create a dimension in the live data model.
Group the Firstname and Lastname in the data model.

 


You have a story based on an import model. The transaction data in the model's data source changes.

How can you update the data in the model?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Refresh the import job
Schedule the import
Allow model import
Refresh the story


You have a dataset that extracts data from an SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) system. The data in the SAP BW system changes. How can you update the dataset?

You must refresh the story that uses the dataset.
You must manually reimport the data.
You can schedule the dataset to update on a regular basis.
You must create a new dataset.


Which SAP Analytics Cloud feature uses natural language processing?

Smart insight
Data analyzer
Digital boardroom
Just Ask feature


Which automatically created dimension type can you delete from an analytic data model?

Date
Generic
Version
Organization

entry.title: Import to model didn't succeed because of a data locking violation SAC
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am encountering an issue with data locks in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). The data locking functionality works perfectly in our Development (Entwicklung) environment, but in the Production environment, it does not function as expected.

When I try to apply or work with data locks in Production, I receive the following error:

Import to model didn't succeed because of a data locking violation. Error code: 3005

Surprisingly, there is another model that works just fine with data locks both in Developing and Production environment.

 

Has anyone faced a similar issue or could suggest possible areas to investigate?
Any advice on what might cause data locks to malfunction in Production but not in Development would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!
